description: Downloading pages then Offline reading, text to speech etc., would be awesome if developed
works great on my yoga
Nvidia + Wayland

Cudos on addressing at many of the issues I read in other reviews. Love the random article feature with Alt+R . It seems to work really well out of the box for me and I was excited to send some positive feedback for that. Maybe it's not all inclusive with account access and such, but I think it's really nice anyway and pinned it to my dash.  Good job!
This works great! I don't see the app icon showing on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS tho.
It serves the purpose with a beautiful interface, easy to read and navigate through. I hope this app survives and matures for a long time to come.
Very useful app, beautiful and practical UI.

But 

why do download size so big - 974.4 MB 

it is text error or sth!
The reader is very nice. I would love to see an option to organize your bookmarks.
Excellent and concise.
I really enjoyed the design.
It's very easy to use. It even supports dark mode which is a plus!
But the line measures are too long. The articles aren't formatted as well as with other tools online.
ye , its working fine , and those who cant able to see it's icon , probably missing repo of flatpack , night moew works well . thank you

Either your using the API or streaming from the download sites. At the very least "Caching". You can do by categories with the systems online as well.

GUI could be improved. as the button for the contents panel is on the right when in Wikipedia the panel is on the left. move the button across. Cool there is a "new tab" button, but why not instead provide it when clicking on links (middle click) and when searching a button popup and shortcut for new tab.

One pretty big problem as well is that Wikipedia provides warnings on certain articles if the information could be inaccurate I tested with SpaceX Starship article did not appear.

The app is a little too big to fit on my tiny monitor, but if a few UI things could be adjusted it would be wonderful. Would also be nice to have a fuzzy search method similar to wikipedia that suggests pages when there isn't an exact match in search.
install and play, great app!
Definitely beats searching on browser

I wish there was a keyboard shortcut for "Random Article" and "Recent Article". I'm baffled they are not included... because it takes 3 clicks to get to a random article. I'm going to open an issue on GitHub and pray for an update.

When I close the software it not keep the tabs I was reading and it has no hotkeys for zooming (ctrl+ or -) or to the sidebar (tab). at least make this possible. idk why wikipedia application is only available for mobile devices it has a lot of cool features in it for ex the "reading lists". they must implement a sync to the account so we can have it on desktop too.
In Ubuntu 22.04 It crashes without actually openning a window. It just shows a spinning wait thingy, shows the menu Gnome breafly and then nothing.
Love the app. Hate the snap. Does not start when icon clicked.
summary: Great app. Snap app does not work, though

description: Love the look of the app and how it integrates into the GNOME environment. Makes for a lovely time reading wikipedia on the desktop without having to open a browser and with dark mode included! My one gripe is the information sidebars of articles look a little strange in dark mode, but otherwise it works perfectly. Well done.
let see gkf i cant

Wikipedia itself is really cool, but reading Wikipedia articles on GNOME with GNOME look and GNOME decided dark / light mode it's really great. 
I personally would enjoy if you could add preferences for multiple custom MediaWiki "instances" like the ArchWiki because it would be really great if I could browse the ArchWiki on GNOME.
summary: Really cool; perhaps add custom MediaWiki instances like the ArchWiki

description: For me, at least, it doesn't display any pages at all. Clicking and dragging, I pull some links around, so it's loading something, but nothing is being rendered.
summary: Would be useful-- unfortunately doesn't work

description:
I really appreciate the added functionality that this gives to wikipedia. More importantly though it helps me to stay away from my web browser which is a huge time and morale thief. I'm also looking forward to putting it on a child-friendly computer.
My only request at this stage would be for text to scale to the full width of my screen.
Thanks to the developer!
well cant immaging
I can scroll down if I use the arrow keys of the onscreen keyboard, but not if I drag my finger up or down the screen.
perfect but i can't log to my wikipedia account
Some performance issues and stutters because written in Python, still a great app.
Durch die Einbindung in die GNOME Suche, lassen sich Artikel einfach und schnell suchen.
#leider schwerfällig im laden und die einstellungen werden nicht gespeichert
Mit diesem Programm kann man die Wikipedia-Artikel ganz einfach ansehen und in diesen Suchen ohne einen Web-Browser öffnen zu müssen.
Gutes Programm, macht was es soll und ermöglicht mir nach Sprachen zu filtern.
Se ve bastante bien, usa libhandy y tiene esquinas redondeadas

Estoy usando la versión 2.0.0 Flatpak en Fedora 38. Me ha impresionado. Muy bien diseñada la interfaz y funciona excelente. Se puede hacer búsquedas en distintos idiomas. Además posee algunas opciones adicionales bastante interesantes para mejorar la experiencia.
No hay idioma español, los términos de busqueda nunca concuerdan o no los consigue. Prefiero crear un acceso directo de Wikipedia en mi escritorio
La idea es buena, aunque algunas paginas no se pueden traducir
Merci pour cette application native qui permet un accès aisé à l’excllente encyclopédie 🤗

Super application pour consulter Wikipédia sur l'ordinateur.
Très bien intégré sur le bureau Gnome !!
